intro: Vittaria guineensis var. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental spikemoss, is a species of spikemoss belonging to the family Selaginellaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems covered in small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces sporophytes that are typically short and stout, with a distinct, often reddish coloration. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
